bootstrap.descriptionBootstrap: Bootstrap is an open source toolkit for developing with HTML, CSS, and JS. You can use Sass variables and mixins, responsive grid system, extensive prebuilt components, and powerful plugins built on jQuery with Bootstrap.
bootstrap.useBootstrap: To use Bootstrap, you need to copy-paste a link inside the head of your page to load the CSS of Bootstrap and some scripts to load the JavaScripts functions
bootstrap.cssLink: Inside tags, in your head, paste this: link rel="stylesheet" href="https://stackpath.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/4.4.1/css/bootstrap.min.css" integrity="sha384-Vkoo8x4CGsO3+Hhxv8T/Q5PaXtkKtu6ug5TOeNV6gBiFeWPGFN9MuhOf23Q9Ifjh" crossorigin="anonymous"

scripts.script: Inside script tag, paste this: src="https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.4.1.slim.min.js" integrity="sha384-J6qa4849blE2+poT4WnyKhv5vZF5SrPo0iEjwBvKU7imGFAV0wwj1yYfoRSJoZ+n" crossorigin="anonymous"

Inside script tag, paste this: src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/popper.js@1.16.0/dist/umd/popper.min.js" integrity="sha384-Q6E9RHvbIyZFJoft+2mJbHaEWldlvI9IOYy5n3zV9zzTtmI3UksdQRVvoxMfooAo" crossorigin="anonymous"

Inside script tag, paste this: src="https://stackpath.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/4.4.1/js/bootstrap.min.js" integrity="sha384-wfSDF2E50Y2D1uUdj0O3uMBJnjuUD4Ih7YwaYd1iqfktj0Uod8GCExl3Og8ifwB6" crossorigin="anonymous"

class.name: Alerts
class.description: Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages.

type.descriptionType: Prints a blue alert message in the screen.
type.useExample: Inside the tags you need to add this: "class="alert alert-primary" role="alert""

type.descriptionType: Prints a yellow alert on the screen.
type.useExample: Inside the tags you need to add this: "class="alert alert-warning" role="alert""

type.descriptionType: Prints a grey transparent alert on the screen.
type.useExample: Inside the tags you need to add this: "class="alert alert-light" role="alert""

class.name: Badges
class.description: Badges can be used as part of links or buttons to provide a counter.

type.descriptionType: Creates a turquoise badge to provide a information counter
type.useExample: Inside the tags you need to add this: "class="badge badge-info""

type.descriptionType: Creates a blue badge to provide a primary counter
type.useExample: Inside the tags you need to add this: "class="badge badge-primary""

type.descriptionType: Creates a green badge to provide a succesful counter
type.useExample: Inside the tags you need to add this: "class="badge badge-success""

class.name: Buttons
class.description: Buttons are used for actions in forms, dialogs, and more. The .btn classes are designed to be used with the button element.

type.useExample: Inside the tags you need to add this: "type="button" class="btn btn-danger""
Inside the tags you need to add this: "type="button" class="btn btn-light""
Inside the tags you need to add this: "type="button" class="btn btn-warning""

class.name: Cards
class.description: A card is a flexible and extensible content container. It includes options for headers and footers, a wide variety of content, contextual background colors, and powerful display options

type.descriptionType: Card creates a little panel with the possibility of adding information like titles, subtitles, etc... inside it
type.useExample: Inside a div tag you need to add this: "class="card""

type.descriptionType: Card-body creates a little panel with the possibility of adding a text content inside it
type.useExample: Inside a div tag you need to add this: "class="card-body""

type.descriptionType: Inside a div with a card class, this class add one image on the top of the card panel
type.useExample: Inside a img tag you need to add this: "class="card-img-top""

class.name: Carousel
class.description: The carousel is a slideshow for cycling through a series of content, built with CSS 3D transforms and a bit of JavaScript.

type.useExample: Inside the tags you need to add this: "class="carousel slide""

class.name: Dropdown
class.description: Dropdowns are toggleable, contextual overlays for displaying lists of links and more.

type.descriptionType: Dropdown deploy a menu under the dropdown button
type.useExample:
This is a code example: "
Action Another action
"

type.descriptionType: Dropright deploy a menu at the right of the dropdown button
type.useExample:
This is a code example: "
Action Another action
"

type.descriptionType: Dropleft deploy a menu at the left of the dropdown button
type.useExample:
This is a code example: "
Action Another action
"

type.descriptionType: Creates a form with the inputs in the same line
type.useExample: Inside a div tag you need to put this code: "class="form-inline""

type.descriptionType: Makes an input tag to only be able to read it and not write on it
type.useExample: Inside a input tag put readonly, for instance: "<input class="form-control" type="text" placeholder="Readonly input hereâ€¦" readonly>"

type.descriptionType: Serves as the point of connection between the user and the server to add files
type.useExample: In a input tag with type file, you need to put this code: "class="form-control-file""
